intro: Kaviria tomentosa, commonly known as the woolly kaviria, is a flowering plant belonging to the Acanthaceae family. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its dense, hairy foliage, which gives it a soft, woolly appearance. Its flowers are typically small and clustered, often in shades of white or pink, and are borne on slender stalks. Kaviria tomentosa thrives in well-drained soils and requires moderate to high levels of sunlight.
